intro: Carpesium spathiforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as swamps, marshes, and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Carpesium spathiforme is known for its ability to thrive in wetland environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
